title: freeairdrops444
author: freeairdrops444
content: Hi DereI have invested in a company and when I tried to make 600$ withdrawal my address saved at company profile was incomplete. Incomplete means the last digit is missing on the address and the withdrawal was pending for a long time but when I contacted to the company suport teamThey said they have paid the withdrawal and change the status from pending to complete.When I checked my account it dont show upon investigation I found that the last digit of address was missing at profile of my company withdrawals account.Now they say that for recovery of transaction I need to pay 120$ more as charge fee. And when I ask to provide transaction ID even it is a incomplete address they don't allow me that and said its a company policy.Now any one guide me what to do in this scenario?

comments.author: Baofeng
comments.body: Several questions:1. Is this the first time that you withdraw from this company?2. Who set up your account? did you double check everything before you make the withdrawal3. Not sure how can they recover the lost funds since according to them they have sent it already (albeit to the wrong address). *Unless that they have control of that wrong address."Worst case though, you may have been scam and your money is gone already.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: I think its kinda hard to believe that the transaction can be process since its not complete address. Usually its not process when its like this and will just noted as failed. Your money should still be on your account. I dont get the 120$ fee just to recover something isnt loss. Its kinda sound like an extorsion.Whats the company name? Its probably an exchange.

comments.author: freeairdrops444
comments.body: Quote from: Baofeng on May 15, 2022, 10:53:05 AMSeveral questions:1. Is this the first time that you withdraw from this company?2. Who set up your account? did you double check everything before you make the withdrawal3. Not sure how can they recover the lost funds since according to them they have sent it already (albeit to the wrong address). *Unless that they have control of that wrong address."Worst case though, you may have been scam and your money is gone already.1. Yes it's first time2. I double check when pasted while setting up my account at company's profile3. Yes that is why i posted here as if transaction went to wrong address that's another issue but it went to incomplete address so it is possible that the transaction can be successful even its incomplete address.Yes may be i have been scammed

Usually its not process when its like this and will just noted as failed. Your money should still be on your account. I dont get the 120$ fee just to recover something isnt loss. Its kinda sound like an extorsion.Whats the company name? Its probably an exchange.Exactly that's what I was thinking that if address is incomplete how they can say that it's processed and when ask by me for transaction ID they forced me to pay charge money of 120$ for recovery of transaction.https://merrilledgeinvestment.com/ this is company nameHow Can i check the USDT TRC20 transaction using explorer i tried but its not showing may be i am not doing it right

comments.author: $anounimus$
comments.body: I suggest following the procedure they say but if they ask to pay a $120 fee make sure there is a guarantee of return to get your money back by contacting the company because if there is a slight error will result in the loss of the value of your investment.

comments.author: freeairdrops444
comments.body: Quote from: $anounimus$ on May 15, 2022, 11:13:04 AMI suggest following the procedure they say but if they ask to pay a $120 fee make sure there is a guarantee of return to get your money back by contacting the company because if there is a slight error will result in the loss of the value of your investment.Their is a doubt now in my mind as i deposited 600$ and I tied to withdraw it for 1st time and we assume that I submit incomplete address in profile. The question is either the incomplete address transaction went successfull or not?Second thing which creates me doubt why they don't send me transaction ID and details so I can check on explorerAnd I don't have any guarantee as I don't have any withdrawal from the company.

comments.author: so98nn
comments.body: They can not mark it as complete, because they never sent it anyways. Incomplete address might have been recognised by the company and now they are just playing with you. Though before withdrawal there is always automated message to double check your address, Check the chain and if the address belongs to it or not. There is possibility that you might have rushed because you were confident you had the info correct. Unfortunately such funds which are sent to unrecognised address, or another chain are lost forever. Due to the nature of irreversible transaction this is lost forever.

Unfortunately such funds which are sent to unrecognised address, or another chain are lost forever. Due to the nature of irreversible transaction this is lost forever. Yes that is my mistake I was confident that I submit right address but when I check the transaction using transaction address at tron explorer of incomplete address it says no record found.Now if i post the wrong address here can any senior member check the transaction went successful or not

This is also what I'm thinking if the address is not existent, then obviously it will not went through and the funds revert back to them.I think the company is just playing with you, $120 is big enough money for some of us here. Did they assure you that if you pay that money, your $600 will be credited to your account or not?Yes, you can post the address here and see if it went through or not.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: It's a freaking scam, mate! Who in the right mind could give those promised returns in the world.How could you get deceived, and where did you find that site?

You must be careful with any low tier exchange site these days and so what kind of platform is that? you need to tell us about that and we can help you with this.

Who in the right mind could give those promised returns in the world.How could you get deceived, and where did you find that site?Now what happens is already happened... comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Quote from: freeairdrops444 on May 15, 2022, 02:30:22 PMQuote from: vv181 on May 15, 2022, 12:35:09 PMIt's a freaking scam, mate! Who in the right mind could give those promised returns in the world.How could you get deceived, and where did you find that site?Now what happens is already happened... Now tell me any way for me that I can retrieve my funds back. The possibility of getting your fund back is almost zero. What did you expect from someone that may anonymously rob you?The only thing you can do is to let it be as a lesson and to self-reflect on how the hell you could believe that site, just simply forget the money. There is an index thread that shows topics about how to protect yourself from a scam, I suggest you read those things.The link is here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5364418.0#post_point151.

Are you sure there is a tx link for this? Cause if not then its not an on chain transaction. I dont know why they are asking for fee to you actually since its shpuld not been processed in the first place anyway.Just send it here and will check whats the status.

comments.author: raidarksword
comments.body: Not allowing to see the transactions to you sounds sketchy and for sure they just scamming you in broad daylight and just want your more money to be handed to them. Don't trust such kind of scam company and putting such risk on withdrawals that asked for huge fees recoveries will make you think straight it is a complete scam.
